trans-unit.source: Defines identifiers that are used to indicate selection rules for a component.
These identifiers indicate whether a component has some form of visible user interface and whether the user can take actions to move or alter the size of the component.
Indicates the component supports sizing in all directions.
Indicates the component supports resize from the bottom.
Indicates the component supports resize from the left.
Indicates the component is locked to its container.

Overrides the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.SelectionRules.Moveable"></xref>, <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.SelectionRules.AllSizeable"></xref>, <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.SelectionRules.BottomSizeable"></xref>, <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.SelectionRules.LeftSizeable"></xref>, <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.SelectionRules.RightSizeable"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.SelectionRules.TopSizeable"></xref> bit flags of this enumeration.
Indicates the component supports a location property that allows it to be moved on the screen.
Indicates the component supports resize from the right.
Indicates the component supports resize from the top.
Indicates the component has some form of visible user interface and the selection service is drawing a selection border around this user interface.

If a selected component has this rule set, you can assume that the component implements <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref> and that it is associated with a corresponding designer instance.
